instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message:
Hello 
Have this board that had corrosion damage. Repaired all the miss obvious missing traces. Replaced both CD3215 chips, along with blown resistors. Also replace U7000. I've reflashed a clean ME and also a complete BIOS. Still not powering up. 

Here are the readings i have so far:

PP3V3_G3H: 3.4
SMC_RESET_L: 3.4
BUF_SMC_RESET_L.: 3.4
PPBUS_G3H: -0.13 (yeah these readings were erratic. I confirmed on oscope, it is generating negative voltage). On one instance, i had 0.3V reading. 
PPBUS_G3H Diode mode: 0.43
TBA_VDDA: 5.2
TBA_VDDP: 5.2
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: 0
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: 0

Any suggestions.

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message:
You still have problems on USB-C areas; why did you touch the BIOS???
Check all LDO for CD3215 chips.
Compare diode mode readings with known good board.

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message:
BIOS was based on the below linked forum as my issue was similar to an extent. I still have the original BIOS if i need to revert: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-00840-5v-on-both-ports-0v-on-pp1v1_upc_x-a-b_ldo_bmc.58788/#post-59269[/URL]

I'm going to have to wait on another board to arrive to compare diode mode reading but so far none of the LDO diode mode readings were off. The all matched between both USB-C chips.

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message:
Any board with CD3215 can serve for comparison.

Main BIOS is not involved in charger detection and power delivery protocol.

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message: compared all the LDO with 820-00840 board and they were identical.

threads.title: 820-00840: PP20V_USBC: 5v and not powering up
threads.message:
If you do npt get 1V1 LDO on the activated port, should be a problem with CD3215 chip.
You can try the trick to bypass IN-OUT the correspondintg MOSFET nand see if get 20V on USB-C port.
It probably doesn't work with problems on both ports, but worth to try...
